properties.name: Backpack inventory
properties.description: A simple backpack inventory that displays collected items alphabetically.

objects.name: instructions
objects.string:
Click items: to add them to the inventory (while closed)
Space: to open the inventory.
X: to close it.
D: to delete the plant from the inventory (while closed).

events.comment: Items are collected by clicking on them when the inventory is closed (isOpen = false). Each time something is collected the variable numberOfItems increases by 1. This variable is used to calculate the width of the panel sprite itemBackground. In your own project, item collection could be done in many different ways and the collectables do not need to be in the same object.

When Space is pressed, you have collected at least 1 item, the inventory is closed and the timer has reached 0.1 seconds, the 'For every child' looks at all the children of collectedItems for any that are true. An instance of inventoryItems is created for any that are true at the x-position held in the xPosition variable. A fixed y-position of 46 is used because this doesn't need to be dynamic. The new inventoryItems instance is set to the relevant animation, based on the collectedItems child name (held in 'itemName'). Child names must match inventoryItems animation names. 100 is added to the xPosition variable, ready for the next inventoryItems that will appear to the right of the last one. The timer check prevents the rapid spamming of the open and close buttons (space and x) from causing the inventory to display incorrectly. isOpen is set to true so that the panel sprite event and the close inventory event can run.

If isOpen is true the backpack animation is set to "open" and the panel sprite background is shown. Panel sprite width is set dynamically using the value held in the numberOfItems variable * 100 (100 pixels per inventoryItems instance). 70 is added to that number to allow for some extra panel sprite to the left and right of the inventoryItems.
The close event resets everything, ready for the next time the player opens the inventory.

An example of just one way to delete an item from the inventory. In this case the d key is pressed to remove the plant specifically, but in your game removal conditions could be anything you like: a variable change, a collision, something triggered in Yarn dialogue etc. Removing an item from the inventory will not create gaps between inventoryItems.
